alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Meigs; Rhea; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 9:49AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT/2 PM EDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Meigs, Rhea and Roane. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT /200 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM CDT /1047 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional heavy rainfall is likely over the next 1 to 2 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Spring City, Melvine, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Piney Falls State Park, Grandview, Mount Crest, Peakland, Eagle Furnace and Fall Creek Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
